overview: This measure has been further amended to incorporate an additional six claims, raising the total number of claims from thirty-one to thirty-seven. The bill's purpose remains to provide appropriations for judgments and settlements against the State. These amendments increase the total appropriation and introduce a new funding source to satisfy the additional liabilities.
appropriations: The total appropriation for fiscal year 2024-2025 has increased by $578,884.33, from $7,854,458.74 to a new total of $8,433,343.07. This funding is designated to satisfy thirty-seven claims against various state departments. The new appropriation consists of $7,023,343.07 from general revenues, $1,320,000.00 from the state highway fund, and $90,000.00 from judiciary funds.
agency_impact: These amendments introduce new liabilities for agencies not included in the previous version's additions. A settlement of $100,000.00 now impacts the Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation. Additionally, the Judiciary is now responsible for a $90,000.00 settlement, which will be paid from its own funds.
revenue_sources: This version of the bill introduces the Judiciary's funds as a new source to pay for claims. An appropriation of $90,000.00 is now designated from judiciary funds to satisfy a specific settlement. Consequently, the appropriations from general revenues and the state highway fund have also been increased to cover the other new claims.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The one-time expenditure for fiscal year 2024-2025 has increased to a new total of $8,433,343.07 to satisfy thirty-seven distinct claims. This increase reflects the addition of six new claims since the previous version of the bill. Key additions include a $100,000.00 general fund settlement for the Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation and a $90,000.00 settlement for the Judiciary, to be paid from judiciary funds. Other new claims impact the Department of Land and Natural Resources and the Department of Education. These appropriations are non-recurring liabilities for FY 2024-2025 and do not establish any ongoing costs or new positions.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The total appropriation has increased from $7,854,458.74 to $8,433,343.07 to account for six additional claims, bringing the total number of claims from thirty-one to thirty-seven. A new funding source, judiciary funds, has been added to pay for a $90,000.00 claim against the Judiciary. The amendments also introduce new liabilities for agencies such as the Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation.
